column5: Gladly send you a couple packages of my "Superb tasting coating mix" in exchange for the chance to submit your great walleye filleting videos on my website for the Fish cleaning impaired.[email protected]
Just messing around with my fishing partners and we put this together... How to clean a walleye.http://www.fishingbuddies.ca/cpg132/...eye%282%29.wmv
Cripes...I thought I was going to see blood spewing like that SNL parody on Julia Child. Heck, I look at my fillet knife and I have a cut on my finger.

I do not want to sound like a know-it-all, but I found a major flaw in the video. After the first fillet, you should take a break and let the fish settle before flipping it and doing the other side. During this break, you can either drink beer from a can, or drink beer from a bottle.
Can you do Y bones from Northern?
nice video! will you sharpen my fillet knives? thanks for posting the video.
Thats a great video. Keep up the good work. Is the first method posted somewhere on the board? I'm going to go searh for it but if not could I get it somehow? Thanks Mike

well, everybody has their favorite way - let me add a few thoughts: 1 - in the second method, if you remove the rib bones BEFORE removing the skin it's much easier and less waste. 2 - removing the "pin bones" - has anybody used the "zipper method" where you hold the fillet by the tail end with both hands and physically pull (zipper) the upper and lower fillets - one half will then have the pin bones than can then be removed with one more zipper move using the knife to start the second zipper??? 3 - a 3 pound walleye is about 20 inches, isn't this abit large?? phish the phish cleaner
Have not tried filleting a 20 inch fish in years...its in the slot. Does the zipper work on 30" fish? Just kidding.
Both methods van be viewed at: http://www.fishingbuddies.ca/Mambo/
